Repository Module¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(db: AsyncSession, contact: ContactCreate, user: User)[source]¶

Creates a new contact and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • contact – The new contact’s details.

  • user – The user who is creating the contact.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an error while creating the contact.

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(db: AsyncSession, contact_id: int, user: User)[source]¶

Deletes a contact by ID if it belongs to the given user.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user – The user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The deleted contact if it exists and belongs to the given user, or None if not found.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(db: AsyncSession, contact_id: int, user: User)[source]¶

Retrieves a contact by ID if it belongs to the given user.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user – The user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The contact if it exists and belongs to the given user, or None if not found.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: AsyncSession, user: User, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10)[source]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts associated with the given user.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • user – The user whose contacts to retrieve.

  • skip – The number of contacts to skip before returning the results.

  • limit – The number of contacts to return.

Returns:

A list of contacts associated with the given user.

async src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession, user: User, days: int = 7, start_date: date = None)[source]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts that have an upcoming birthday in the given time range.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • user – The user whose contacts to check.

  • days – The number of days to check for upcoming birthdays, starting from today.

  • start_date – The start date of the range to check for birthdays. If None, defaults to today.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays, along with a message describing the birthday.

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: AsyncSession, query: str, user: User)[source]¶

Searches for contacts by query.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • query – The search query.

  • user – The user whose contacts to search.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the given query.

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(db: AsyncSession, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, user: User)[source]¶

Updates an existing contact and returns the updated contact.

Parameters:

  • db – The database session to use.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact – The updated contact details.

  • user – The user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact if it exists and belongs to the given user, or None if not found.

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an error while updating the contact.

async src.repository.users.confirm_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Verify a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address of the user to verify.

  • db – The database session to use.

Returns:

None

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found, or if there is an error while updating the database.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → User[source]¶

Creates a new user and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – The new user’s details.

  • db – The database session to use.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email address is already registered.

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), response: bool = False) → UserResponse | User | None[source]¶

Get a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address of the user to find.

  • db – The database session to use.

  • response – If True, return the user as a UserResponse object. Otherwise, return the User ORM object.

Returns:

The user if found, or None if not.
